alert.note: Alert for Seminole (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 23 at 4:39PM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Seminole County through 515 PM EDT... At 438 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over University Of Central Florida, moving north at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Sanford, Altamonte Springs, Oviedo, Winter Springs and Casselberry. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. These types of funnel clouds are harmless, but on rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors and report your sighting to the National Weather Service.
